intro: Grewia antsiranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar gumtree, is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually oval or elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round fruits that are often red or orange when mature. Grewia antsiranensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
